messenger.note: Capitalize 'M' when referring to Intercom Messenger.

help centre.note: Use US English and initial caps.

docs.note: Use Help Center if referring to the destination. Use 'articles' if referring to content.

the documentation.note: Use the correct content type name, or replace with the title of the article or collection.

the messenger.note: Never use the in front of Messenger.

team mate.note: All one word. Only capitalize at the start of a sentence.

login to.note: ‘Log in’ is the verb form, ‘login’ (unfortunately) is the noun.

get setup.note: ‘Set up’ is a phrasal verb, ‘setup’ (as in setup guide) is an adjective. Never set-up.

set-up.note: ‘Set up’ is a phrasal verb, ‘setup’ (as in setup guide) is an adjective. Never set-up.

on-boarding.note: Avoid hyphens unless they add clarity.

as of yet.note: Wordy phrases create distance. Avoid them.

due to the fact that.note: Wordy phrases create distance. Avoid them.

centre.note: Use US English. If referring to a Help Center, use capitals.

unfortunately.note: Don't apologize, just help. Give a next step or some context.

sorry.note: Don't apologize, just help. Give a next step or some context.

oops.note: Don't apologize, just help. Give a next step or some context.

click on.note: Avoid needless words. If this is link text, avoid 'click' and link a key phrase to give context and make the link easy to see.

drop-down menu.note: Avoid hyphens unless they add clarity.

real-time.note: Avoid hyphens unless they add clarity. And definitely avoid hyphenating 'real time' if it's not being used as an adjective.

in-app message.note: Say message when referring to content. Say in-app when referring to the channel.

Message.note: Content formats don't need capitals unless they're at the start of a sentence.

Article.note: Content formats don't need capitals unless they're at the start of a sentence.

Collection.note: Content formats don't need capitals unless they're at the start of a sentence.

Chat.note: Content formats don't need capitals unless they're at the start of a sentence.

Note.note: Content formats don't need capitals unless they're at the start of a sentence.

Post.note: Content formats don't need capitals unless they're at the start of a sentence.

&amp;.note: Don’t use a plus or ampersand as a replacement for and.
